topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52dd5ccc63687272fcd60000#post_52dd5ccc63687272fcd60000

Make a shovel, and terraform some shit.

Depending on what I'm building I like to clear out a level an area the size of what I want, then dig an outline of my building and its rooms. I'll fill these lines with cobblestone to serve as a foundation, then dig out the internal area and lay down whatever blocktype I want to be my floor. That's how I prepare the area for construction and setting up construction.

Usually I'll end up destroying any and all forests around me on my quest for wood and other basic resources. But I tend to keep the saplings to replant to keep a sustainable wood supply, or for decoration.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52dd5ccc63687272fcd60000#post_52dd5ccc63687272fcd60000
Flat land make it easy, though spoil the scenery that a realistic terrain can give. By using stuff like single player commands to copy a bunch of airs cube to replace a mountain you can get a very easy way to remove the biggest obstacles.

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52dd5e916368726c42940100#post_52dd5e916368726c42940100

Ah... Well I always sort of blindly built whatever I wanted after I laid down the foundations and floor. Except for maybe the barn I'm building on EQP's server.


I guess what you could do then, in lack of any idea, is to look at pictures of palace's or fancy estates to figure out what you want to do, or make it look like. From there, it's just knowing what blocks to use to get the right look. Also properly lighting the damn thing.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body: You could always watch some video tutorials on Youtube. Minecraft is one of those games (Like Terraria) that might require some research before playing.

Think I'm gonna make a world full of libraries. You know, use the bookshelf blocks to their full effect, build a bunch of tables and leave notebooks with a few phrases from novels out. Because why not?

I hope to have many fancy outbuildings and a mighty mansion on the land.

In the meantime, it's just an orderly farm with scattered wheat fields because there were too many hills to work around when establishing my basic accommodations.


I'll probably build a wall around my land too, for the shits.

topics.body: You know what sucks?  When you're playing a rpg game and fighting a really hard boss with no health left when you use your ultimate attack that sucks up sp like no tomorrow only for the boss to survive with 1 hp and then kill you resulting in having to repeat the fight.
